Recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2023
It is a very nice concept. I didn't finish the game, but as an hones advice for VR players: I have been playing VR for 2 years now. I never once got VR sick enough to stop playing. That was before I tried playing in hyperbolic space. It probably will get you sick. I guess that with time you will probably get used to it, but it is the most VR sickness inducing game I ever played. I always, when possible play with smooth turning and don't like to teleport. I have a good amount of resistance to VR sickness. Play the game, it is fun and worth it, but be advised. Maybe playing flatscreen before VR would have made my brain more used to the space.

3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2023
Short and charming, I like games that experiment with non-euclidian geometry and perspective trickery.
It has a few flaws: The main gimmick gave me a light headache, and the repeating environments make it difficult to properly navigate open spaces, and the end sequence uses entirely new mechanics.

If you are conscious of the playtime you get for your money, you might want to skip this one, I finished it in less then 3 hours.

Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2023
Short and sweet mind-bending game that uses non-euclidean geometry in very fun ways. Runs really efficiently on Windows and Linux. Cute characters, some really fun and varied gameplay. And there is a great dev log on YouTube if you're interested.

Could cause motion sickness for some, so take breaks. Highly recommended.
 
Aaaaandyyyy
392 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2023
i have not completed it yet, but so far...

it's fine. story is forced and weak, game is overall pretty short. could be better, in a lot of ways, but still worth checking out. there's waaay too many NPCs that make overall experience quite long and tedious, with some of them giving actual helpful clues and others being rather misleading. puzzles are quite fun to figure out, although not as difficult as some tryhards would want to. also many of those puzzles are so subtle so you can easily miss them and not notice at all.

main problem with games based around niche mechanics and stuff like non-Euclidean space is that it can be quite hard to introduce interesting story, to establish good deep lore. gameplay can be obvious here, but story is the roadblock in games like this, once main mechanic or gimmick is done.

solid 8/10, please try harder on lore and story, and readjust the puzzles and NPCs with clues to be bit more distinctive and noticeable in crowd. player movement could be improved, too.
 
/home/cavej376
44 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2023
I'm in two minds about this game. On the one hand, it is an excellent demo of Euclidean space. On the other, it is not that great as an actual game. It seems to expect you to be so at awe at the awesomeness of being in hyperbolic or spherical space, that you forget that gameplay matters.

Specifically:

* too much gameplay rests on talking to everyone until you find the special person you're supposed to talk to to give you the next item
* it is too easy to get information from players in the game, skim read it, forget it, and have no idea what you're supposed to be doing.
* shooting the gophers is confusing and seems to be random (just shoot at loads of holes until one happens to pop up while the bullet is en-route)
* the final boss is out of character with the rest of the game

of the sub-games, only the maze really uses the non-conventional geometry as a useful gameplay mechanic. Most of the sub-games would work just as well in "normal" geometry.
 
jim.higson
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2023
Have you ever wondered what it would be like to live in a Non-Euclidean space? If you are a geometry nerd like me, you probably have. This game is the closest we are likely to get to that experience any time soon! It allows us to explore true curved space, and not just a bunch of invisible portals that are still Euclidean. And on top of that, we can experience the space in immersive VR! What more could you want?

I did feel some slight dizziness from the spacial distortions in VR, but it was not enough to distract from my enjoyment of the game. Those who are more prone to motion sickness, may wish to play in desktop mode instead. Although I highly recommend the VR experience, if you can stomach it.

I was able to complete most of the game in VR, but I struggled to finish some of the in-game tasks. I especially struggled with the drone race and the snowball fight. Fortunately I was able to complete them in desktop mode, and then continue in VR. And you will want to 100% this game, in order to see everything and get the best possible ending.

I have been a fan of CodeParade on YouTube for a while, so I might be a bit biased. But I still think that Hyperbolica is the best visualization of Non-Euclidean geometry I have ever seen. I'm still amazed at how he managed to render curved space in real time, despite watching his dev-logs. It truly is a marvel!
 
JakeDaFoxie
595 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2023
Hyperbolica is actually really nice. The puzzles and minigames are fun, clever and do a decent job of playing with the unique properties of hyperbolic space. The game itself is short but has some really fun and clever moments and clearly took a lot of work to get running. As far as story goes, it can be a bit silly at times, but the ending is cute. Overall, hyperbolica is game that is very short but sweet and really does fulfill the intention CodeParade wanted. He's stated in the past that he wanted hyperbolica to show what it's like to actually live in hyperbolic space, and he certainly succeeded.

Sp1ky
69 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2023
It's good, and the only game I've played with hyperbolic space. I'm sure there are others out there, but considering the detail and effort that CodeParade made to write this in its own engine, I'd hazard a guess that this is the only 3D hyperbolic game with a truly working first-person physics and light engine.

It's kind of trippy and movement feels a little slow, but if the walking speed were any faster I'd probably throw up, so it's struck the best balance you can get with how stretched space is. Additionally, the main reason I got this game was so I could more easily conceptualize hyperbolic space. This game is great at helping with that goal; there are multiple aspects of hyperbolic space that are different than our ordinary, Euclidean space (like how truly prodigiously big an area is in hyperbolic space, or how your field of vision gets more curved with elevation, or how projectile physics would work), and they're all explored in this game.
 
Runnerup

La Pelada de Maldacena

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2023
For a game that is basically a walking simulator, it's pretty fun. The writing is funny, the occasional puzzles make good use of the non-euclidean space, the world is really fun to explore, and there are some clever perspective moments and permutations on the basic idea. The VR experience is nauseating simply due to the massive perspective shift, but interesting to try out. Oh yeah, and the music is excellent. In terms of game soundtracks, it's up there with Card City Nights and Off-Peak.

A short game that deserves all the time you give it. Great game.

Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2023
The only reason I am recommending this is because I want the developers to make a sequel that isn't so abysmally short, I am ALWAYS disappointed when I'm absorbed into an atmosphere for a game and then it ends abruptly

But....

It is a fantastic non-euclidean game and the story was simple yet worked really well with the style and setting. There was 2 puzzles that utilised the non-euclidean format in a really interesting way and the way the world changed as I moved around made for some good exploration whilst keeping the map small as to not get boring, there was also a lot of cool visuals
 
Egasuas
318 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2023
HYPErbolica.
In this game, parallel lines doesn't exist, even though they seem they do. Not gonna lie I did get a bit of motion-sickness playing this even on a screen because this game basically destroyed Euclidean geometry. Nothing is in the way you expect it to be. It is surreal.
Love the robot NPCs. My little interpretation is that humans cannot survive in this world where geometry is "wrong" to them and robots replaced them. They do feel very lively (although none of them are voiced) and I like them.
Sadly my potato laptop cannot run this game very smoothly and
(SPOILERS AHEAD)
.
.
.
.
.
during the boss fight it lagged to death but I was able to continue anyways.
.
.
.
.
CodeParade did a phenomenal job creating this game and boy do I love the music. It is a bit short and were there Aperture-like puzzles I would love it even more. I am very sure that there are tons of content I have not explored but I'll save that to when I upgrade my potato.
BUY THIS GAME AND SUPPORT CODE PARADE.

This game easily deserves both GOTY and VR GOTY! And it's one of the best games I've ever played. It's fun, a little puzzling, absolutely non-violent, somewhat educative, and has lots of good humour in it. So unless traveling through non-euclidean spaces makes you extra dizzy, definetely try Hyperbolica out!
 
StarFallen
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2022
An excellent demo of non-euclidean geometry in game design.

The execution is passable, but the difficulty for 100% completion has a few random spikes, and, while I encountered no bugs playing with mouse and keyboard, reports of bugs in VR from the community are common.

The story and jokes often require being in on fairly uncommon tech and/or math concepts, but the central narrative is interesting and approachable enough.

Overall, the main reason to play is for the novelty of the scratch-made non-euclidean game engine, which provides an experience that simply cannot be compared to anything else currently available. It is something that I recommend people experience.

I got from first launch to the true ending in four hours of gameplay.

Obwohl das Spiel kurz ist, bietet es eine unglaubliche Erfahrung. Es nimmt das Konzept des hyperbolischen Raums und bringt es an seine Grenzen, wobei es unsere Vorstellung davon, wie sich der Raum verhalten sollte, ständig in Frage stellt. Es lohnt sich auf jeden Fall.

wutzibaer
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2022
Hyperbolica is not long, or challenging, or particularly thought-provoking. That's fine, not every game needs to be any of those. What Hyperbolica is however, is pure technology in video game form.

From a distance, Hyperbolica is a walking simulator with a series of gimmicky locations: jungle maze, vaporwave museum, giant restaurant, snow field, and so on. The major sticking point here is that every one of these locations' true gimmick is that it is comprised of an entirely different construct of non-Euclidean space!

The excuse plot is all a setup to place you in a fully-constructed environment that defies basic logic-- the in-game map needs multiple different display modes just to help you understand where your immediate location is. The experience of trying to orient yourself inside an inverted sphere in first-person is worth the price of admission alone.
 
Activated Charcoal

6.1 h en tout

While the game is short, it offers an incredible experience. It takes the concept of hyperbolic space and pushes it to its limit, constantly challenging our idea of how space should behave. Definitely worth it

Faubaulaus
1,087 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2022
This game literally, actually hurts to play. I'm not exaggerating, the reality warping effects of its non-euclidean geometry caused me to develop headaches when I played for long enough. I mention this to warn people that breaking the laws of reality can screw with your mind. Literal infohazard. I don't usually suffer motion sickness in games, but I imagine this game would likely be rough for people who do.

That said, if you can push through the literal mindfnck, the game's quite enjoyable. I actually started following this game way back when it was just devlogs on YouTube, because it has proven one of the only opportunities to experience hyperbolic or spherical space. As far as simulations of that go, it's pretty solid.

But, ignoring the, frankly, obvious gimmick to the game, how's the game itself?

Well, it's an adventure puzzle game. The puzzles, overall, are pretty solid, many utilizing the gimmick to make for unique puzzles other games simply couldn't manage. The story is fairly basic, but has a decent degree of intrigue pointing at a secret ending. The dialogue, overall, is silly and fairly witty.

Overall, the game is quite good. Just, you know, don't try to complete it in one sitting, especially not on VR, Like I said, this game will fnck with your head.

Fanged
75 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2022
I did take some courses on General Relativity (I'm a Physicist), and in those courses I did explore mathematically some consequences of living some non-euclidean geometries. But I was always left wondering how it would be to actually experience them.

This game was the most concrete answer that I could wish. after playing for just a few moments, I could realize how my imagination did not come nearly as close to how it is.

This game was incredibly interesting. The story is pretty nice, the characters are quite likeable, but most of all, you get to experience non-euclidean geometries (especially hyperbolic). The soundtrack is quite nice too, it is pretty chill and doesn't get in the way of the visual experience (which is the most important in this game, I guess).

The quests seem a bit silly, but they are actually really well thought as means to make you experience the geometry. These tasks will be really hard at first, but after a few tries you should try to think how could you use the geometry in your favor. Pulling out these strategies is really satisfying!

I did get a bit of motion sickness, though I was not playing it in VR. It is a good idea to take a few breaks. And maybe playing with your monitor a bit further away than usual.

I really wish to thank the team behind this game for showing that it is possible to make fun and engaging games to convey weird ideas, such as non-euclidean geometries. That is really inspiring. Thanks a lot, from the bottom of my heart!

And finally, rocket skis are rad!

Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
Really nice game about curved spacetime. It feels really interesting and unique.
As a game, it's not very engaging. Especially talking to people feels boring cause the main idea is a lot more interesting but dialogue system doesn't support that core idea. There are some fun puzzles that uses curved space as a mechanic so those are nice.

If you're interested in Math or Physics, definitely check this out. But if you're looking for a high action with epic story and explosions, you might not like this one
 
wolderado
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2022
Despite the hours of frustration I spent attempting to fix a desktop mode launch crash which showed no indication of even having been started besides being in task manager (apparently due to testing, it may have had something do with my VR headset being plugged in to charge on PC startup), I very heavily enjoyed this game. It's so cute and relaxing, especially with the OST.

I played 100% of the game in Desktop mode (and tested VR mode after for the achievement). I will admit, for a little while before I got used to the way the world looks when you move, I still got a little motion sick when playing with the default FOV. Also got confused and lost a handful of times.

Minor Spoiler: Corneilius needs a hug and I wished to give him one the whole game. Corneilius hug button when? /joke
Gameplay Spoiler: I also saw some reviewers commenting that the rocket ski minigame, and I'm not sure why people hate it. It's decently hard, especially the achievement, but honestly it's not that bad. I do understand why someone might dislike it though.

All in all, solid game and amazing OST that I now am forced to buy because it's really really good music. :::}

Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to reorient myself in euclidean space as the text i'm writing is giving me the illusion of non-parallel double-converging lines.

Mikael Åkerfeldt
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2022
I loved this game.
and here's why:
It's a completely different experience than any 3D game because it uses Hyperbolic geometry.
It introduces the player to such complex concepts in a such simple way.
It may get you dizzy, but if you don't play it for too much at a time, you can breeze past this game pretty easily.
The game is also pretty short but pretty fun and pretty innovative!
I wouldn't call this a tech demo, even tho much bigger things could spark out of this concept and engine!
Great work CodeParade!

Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2022
While it's a cool concept, it's more of a tech demo than a game and, in my opinion, a little overpriced. With my current price/hour ratio being about $3, it's similar to my Superhot VR ratio, but I'm also not done with SHVR yet.

TL;DR: It's a tech demo that I would recommend getting on sale.

Navigating hyperbolic space is simply difficult. Making a game that is based entirely in hyperbolic space must've been incredibly difficult. Much more so than CodeParades dev logs on YouTube probably shows. For being such a short game, the concept itself was really fun and interesting and made my eyes hurt.
I haven't played it in VR yet but frankly that seems like a really disorienting time.

199 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2022
I watched the making of this game and liked the concept and following along.  
The game play was alright, nothing too special.   The hyperbolic space is fun and trippy though the novelty of it wears off pretty quickly.  It's fun to see how things work and the quarks of hyperbolic space.  I think one playthrough is plenty for me.  I got lucky and ended up at the snow level for my last area.  That's where things really took a turn downhill for me.  Forced to talk to the NPCs which is quite the chore with not enough direction where to go and then the longest game of telephone.  I think if I came to this place first I don't know if I would have made it through the rest of the game.   Then the end was very unclear.  Spoilers - All I did was walk for 15 mins and somehow the game ended.   Not sure what I was supposed to do but whatever I did it worked.
Do I regret buying this game no.   I'm happy to support a small creator with a unique design.   Thanks for making the game.
Maybe there will be a Hyperbolica 2

Finished within 3 hours but for only $15AUD (summer sale) it was a cool experience and one I'll probably get more use out of showing to friends etc (will definitely need to try in VR!). A serious amount of work would have gone into creating the graphics engines to build hyperbolic and spherical worlds. Would love to see a follow up game where the dev spends more time on gameplay, using what they developed here!

i will be back
105 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2022
Hyperbolica is an incredible tech demo that bends perception and physics with impossible space and non-euclidean geometry. The highlight of which is a farm where the refraction is so high that distant objects will get bigger as you walk away until a gopher will fill up the sky. With so much to love about this game my overriding take away is just a skipping vinyl record of me muttering shut up shut up shut up shut up shut up. There are jokes that work and reflect on the fascinating ideas of the physics of the world but they are buried under hundreds of text boxes of inane patter. It is sad that the makers clearly put so much work to bring its physics to life can't think of anything to actually do with it. 90% of the game is spent talking to the dozens of identical NPCs hoping one of them will cough up a trinket or better yet a minigame. These snippets of interactivity being the high point of the game where it actually leans into its gimmick. Be it shooting sky gophers, pelting kids with snowballs using strange parabola, and zooming through an infinite cafe on rocket skates. Or leaving you to play with trampolines and ponder a round path that somehow has 8 right angles.

Not since Okami have I longed this badly for an editor to come in and cut out 75% of the script.

Despite the complaints I can't help but recommend it for the brave and truly exciting experiment it is. I just hope the team can take the code they made here and find a game to put it in.

loaf
326 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2022
Hyperbolica is in my opinion a ok game. Nothing in it is inherently unfun to do, but also nothing stands out in terms of gameplay. There is a number of things to do for you while playing but only two puzzles are impossible outside of a Non-Euclidean space. That's a bit sad for a game with a Non-Euclidean world. Also the story is more of pointer where to go next rather than being a story. It does its job, but i think a more narrative driven story would have been better. And more puzzles would have helped with the length. Hyperbolica is also a little on the short side.

Noteworthy :
  • If you have problems with motion sickness Hyperbolica might not be a good choice.
  • You can't 100% this game unless you have a VR headset.

I still recommend Hyperbolica.

Unicode
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2022
Killer concept, good story, okay levels, subpar execution, good ending

This game is no joke. It delivers 100% on its core ideäs, but those core ideäs may leave you dizzy. Exercise discretion and take. breaks.
After seeing this game in development, I must admit I am floored by the sheer amount of content it contains, compared with what was shown early on. Rather than a mere tech demo, this game is truly a game, replete with minigames, engaging character arcs, mysteries to uncover, and more.
The core gameplay is rather simple: walk around hyperbolic space and talk to people. If you enjoy exploration and wrapping your mind around a new location, Hyperbolica is just the challenge you might enjoy; relearning the art of wayfinding and building a mental map of the hyperbolic world were a surprisingly fun part of the experiënce. If you don't enjoy doïng this, there's also a map at your disposal, as well as signage and landmarks to guide you when you get lost. In terms of reälism, some may complain that (with the sole exception of a certain section near the end of the game) the game isn't actually fully hyperbolic, just hyperbolic in 2D and vertically Euclideän, but in my opinion, this is already enough of a novel concept; making the platforming even harder would just be a detriment.
The core gameplay is, however, not the only type of gameplay; there are races against time, platforming challenges, and more. This is not necessarily a good thing. Don't get me wrong; it's good to have variëty, but Hyperbolica's minigames are incredibly hit-and-miss. Even the worst ones are kinda fun, but the difficulty curve is simply nightmarish, and the objectives aren't always clearly communicated. For example, there's a mandatory snowball fight to progress the story, but the (incredibly strict!) lose condition isn't explained at all. Another puzzle involving gophers is inventive and takes advantage of Hyperbolica's unique mechanics, but there's no indication of what the gophers' behaviour is, other than "hides if you try to shoot at it". Again, these were fun once you get the hang of things, but this game desperately needs either better communication or a GameFAQs walkthrough.
The story is inventive and, dare I say, groundbreaking. It considers ideäs that I rarely even see seriously explored in the most niche sciënce fiction. No spoilers here, but suffice to say that the way the game presents the central mystery is very fun to uncover and decrypt. I will say, however, the plottwist near the end kinda felt like a slap in the face, and it will be a very unsatisfying and possibly even insultingend for all the non-completionists out there. The 100% ending makes up for it in spades, but it and the plotholes it creätes are frustrating enough for me not to give the story full marks.
Overall, this is a surprisingly short game, and its runtime isn't all home-runs, but I'd recommend Hyperbolica to anyone who enjoys exploration in games.
 
LuduCxiojnEcxHomojn
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2022
Hyperbolica feels like the end result of a long evolution of games with the of premise non-euclidian geometry, all of it made by a single developer.

➕
+Entirely unique visuals with the hyperbolic and spherical geometry.
+Well thought out gameplay which complements and builds on the trippy visuals.
+Simple but fitting graphics and models, especially at the museum.
+Surprisingly fun and interesting story, including a final boss and a redemption arc. Don't
expect an emotional masterpiece though.

➖
-Rather short, though there are some activities to be done after completion.
Some may conclude it's the perfect size.
-The farm activity was quite annoying and difficult (skill issue?).
-A lot of the limited time was spent walking around, instead of actual gameplay. Maybe this
comes from a desire to create an actual narrative, instead of focusing solely on exploring the
the interesting mechanics in a vacuum.


4/5 - Common W from CodeParade
 
SirSwedeMan
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2022
It's a short game but I really enjoyed my time with it. There are lots of fun characters and I thought their dialogue was well written, I really felt a connection talking to them and was rooting for them! The mini games and puzzles throughout were fun and tied in well with the characters. I thought they were a great way to show how the various spaces worked. I would pick a favorite place but I really enjoyed them all! Overall a great game with a very unique concept.

The only things holding this back I would say are the price and the nausea inducing perspective. Luckily I was able to adapt to the perspective after only playing for a little bit but I could definitely see how some people would not be able to play through the whole game because of it. In regards to the price, it is a bit steep considering the length of the game but I wanted to support the developer because what he's made is very impressive. It's well polished and an extremely unique concept. If you don't know much about the developer I highly suggest looking up CodeParade on YouTube. The devlogs for this game are really interesting. I'm really looking forward to more from CodeParade and I wish him and the team all the best!

This... I did not expect this game to be way more trippy than I thought it would be. Had I used VR I probably would've fallen down irl a couple of times. The game is short but the experience is very unique... and trippy.

I did notice that on the native linux version the text boxes and map were flickery so if you are playing on linux or devices with Steam OS I'd recommend playing with Proton enabled HOWEVER enabling Proton does make certain spoiler-y cutscenes/movies not play at all or play really weirdly depending on the version of Proton you use.

Anchovy
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2022
TLDR; it is worth playing, especially in VR, but it is more of a proof-of-concept than a game.

This game feels pretty interesting because it shows how different space could be because of changes in its intrinsic qualities. That thought albeit a bit mathematical does provide a lot of ground for gameplay and novel experience.

On the poor side I would note short story, not stellar visuals, and sometimes awkward dialogues. The plot doesn't pull you by the hand, that allows for peaceful exploration, but combined with vast amounts of space in a rather small actually world this sometimes produces lack of motivation.

All in all, this is a very novel kind of experience, and I sure hope it will progress further, it would be awesome to experience other kinds of games in hyperbolic (or spheric for that matter) space.

Besides, I think this game deserves being bought even if only for the amount of work done for forcing game engine to work with non-euclidean geometry. You should check out author's blog if you have not done so yet.

Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2022
This game messes with my head, in a good way. I've never played anything like it. Walking around in a place where the physics are so fundamentally different from our own is a weird feeling that's hard to explain, you kinda just have to try it for yourself.
I haven't tried out the VR support yet but I bet it's even better than on desktop. Disclaimer, I take no responsibility if you come out of VR after playing the game and you are unable to think in 3 dimensions anymore.
This is probably not the VR game for those who are prone to motion sickness, but other than that, you'll have a great time whether you're playing on desktop or VR.

4PPL35
285 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mai 2022
Hyperbolica foi um jogo muito bom para mim!

Toda questão de espaços não euclidianos eu achei super bem realizada, com cada fase explorando aspectos diferentes da movimentação em ambientes assim. Depois de um tempo você pega o jeito da coisa, mas a sensação de existir mais espaço do que o normal consegue carregar o jogo longe.

Os minigames também são bem divertidos, embora bastante simples. Eu achei super nostálgico o formato do jogo, com um hub com várias fases para explorar, e daí misturado nelas alguns minigames ou puzzles espaciais simples. Tem muitos personagens para conversar também, e a maioria deles tem falas legais.

Por fim, gostaria de dar uma atenção especial para a música. Super atmosférica, com algumas distorções e efeitos que encaixam perfeitamente na proposta do jogo. E, mesmo que curto, existem algumas faixas bem memoráveis e que já estou reouvindo no Spotify.

No geral, eu diria que esse jogo é um pacote completo. Vale muito à pena!
 
devlog98
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
While I recommend the game, it's far from what I would call worth playing. If the concept of your brain being slightly confused by what he sees and how everything works, is intriguing to you - you should pick it up and try it. It is very short, the world is small and the story is rather simple, so do not expect much. View it more as a tour or demonstration of an interesting concept.

Personally I didn't find the puzzles challenging, and hyperbolic geometry was more than intuitive by the end of the game. Only one map mode is truly useful, the one that displays entire level but compresses it near the edges. Some dialoges got the chuckle out of me, mostly youtuber and IT NPCs. The window cleaning moment was hilarious! Sadly, I was naseous for more than 2 hours after playing, so it may cause motion sickness even without VR.
 
E100
347 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2022
I'm just going to be up front about this. This is not a game, it's more of a tech demo or interactive art, though there is a collectathon-style aspect to it if you want to explore the worlds further. This can be beaten in about an hour and a half, just on a casual playthrough, so it is a little on the short side.
However, it is a stunning marvel of a tech demo, exploring the possibility of utilising hyperbolic space in an interactive format, and a great example of the beginnings of what could be done with it. CodeParade has made some videos on YouTube exploring the possibility of hyperbolic space, even emulating it in a game engine. This is a prime example of the sheer amount of time and effort they have put into this exploration, and I am glad I spent the money on this.
If you are looking to explore concepts never-before-seen in an interactive format, please: Buy Hyperbolica. It has been amazing to see what has become of CodeParade's work, not to mention everyone else who worked on this.

Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2022
Amazing experience with several "wow" moments. The story is compelling which motivates exploration and talking with NPCs. Platforming, flying as a drone, and roller skating in the cafe were some of my highlights. I was frustrated by the gopher/burrow projectile puzzle because it seemed a bit random but I was glad some NPCs gave hints and it might just be me.
Also I really appreciate ultrawide support in a title like this even though I did not expect it for an indie title.
Will probably come back to 100% this down the line.
 
Kestah
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2022
Delightful new mind-bender. Better-polished than all the others I've played recently, and is actually playable on my potato, unlike most games available today. Aside from occasional camera shakiness, I can't fault it. It doesn't *feel* low-spec.
As to the gameplay, I literally cannot explain it. Nothing I can say will make sense until you play the game. There's more than 360 degrees in a circle. Everything is really far away but you can get there at a slow walk. It takes five right-angle right-turns to make a left. More inventive than Portal.

geshusbakagen
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2022
I liked it.
Wholesome story with good foreshadowing (if you talk to certain npcs), decent twist and surprisingly dark undertones/themes although they're definitely not explored as much as they could have been. not really an issue though cause i didn't really expect much of a story to begin with since its main selling point, as many have stated, is the weird environments it has you explore. In that regard it met and even surpassed my expectations.
I've seen many criticise the gameplay but to me it just sounds like they wanted another game entirely but with this geometry. I'm sure hyperbolic fps and platformers will come eventually but for what Hyperbolica is, its very enjoyable.
The dialogue is interesting and varied and, having literally talked to every single npc, there is only a handful that I'd say didnt have anything to add or would have been better left out. this is subjective obviously as i am the kind of kid who would talk to every npc i could find in pokemon as well.
The puzzles aren't too challenging but they show you the different ways you can interact with non-euclidian geometry and the mini-games, although a bit clunky, are a lot of fun.
it's also nice to be able to collect everything in a game without it taking months off your life.

Short game so probably wait for a sale if your not sure you'll like it, but worth full price imo if you're looking for the kind of unique experience it offers.

Recommandé
8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2022
The gameplay is less than captivating, but what's truly phenomenal about this game is its curved geometry. If you're a math or engineering geek, Hyperbolica is genuinely non-trivial entertainment and full of clever math references.

If you're looking for a more traditional PC game with complex dynamics and impressive graphics, you may not enjoy Hyperbolica as much. But it's a real milestone in video gaming nonetheless. Perfecting its physics and graphics engine, and a more developed storyline will make something truly revolutionary.

Havhingstor
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2022
TL;DR This is the strongest framework for a unique collect-a-thon I've ever played, with awesome art and music to accentuate and heighten the already well crafted visual experience, but it pains me to say that such a solid foundation is floundered in some regard by the story, the dialogue and the utilisation of the core mechanics. I would still recommend it, but just approach everything character/story related with a grain of salt.

Obviously, this game's most prevalent and strongest attribute is the visual presentation, with the non-euclidean distortion giving an intriguing visual depth that never ceases to surprise; all of it framed in a very pleasing and simple art style, which aids in shifting focus towards the distortion and not overstimulating the player. The only area that looked particularly drab was the snow level, as it was lacking any interesting iconography and was just white.

I found the music to be incredibly well made and catchy, with each area having a distinct sound, feeling and appropriate tone. I sometimes just visited areas or played minigames to enjoy the soothing or bouncy tunes and I haven't been able to stop listening to the soundtrack ever since I completed the game.

The story was, to put it bluntly, uninspired and inconsequential. There are some lore bits sprinkled here and there, but it isn't communicated to you subtly throughout the game and everything is told to you by the end, not to mention how basic and contrived it is. The most complex deduction I had to do to find out what a lore piece meant was run it through a hexadecimal translator, not interpret it, which says a lot about its depth. The characters also embody that lack of depth, with them being incredibly one note and incredibly archetypal, like the Youtuber and your self-appointed 'sidekick', both of which were very cliché and uninteresting.

The dialogue was okay overall, but some interactions were really fun or informative, with the latter shedding light on the quirks present in non-euclidean geometry, which was really cool to find out and listen to. Conversely, the other interactions were overly-cynical reinterpretations of average phrases (the Youtube guy incarnate), psuedo-ironic puns and just general bland interactions.

I think the most disappointing aspect of this game is its underutilisation of the worlds, as all the areas (especially the art gallery) have a lot of empty space that serves no purpose, which is such a shame as the crux of hyperbolic space is 'having more space in less perceived space' and beckons to have its nooks and crannies brimming with secrets and new content. Also, I found the spherical geometry to be the most visually intriguing and engaging, yet it is entirely neglected for most of the game, with only one small area having it (Edit: Thinking about it a bit more from a design perspective, spherical doesn't lend itself well to many mechanics, and that's probably why). If there is any DLC for this game, I would love it to have equal parts hyperbolic as it does spherical.

Overall, I enjoyed myself greatly with this game, as its integral artistic and design elements fascinate me greatly and its world exploration form factor is unparalleled by other games, but the content that inhabits the world leaves more to be desired.
 
redkidd.sleeps.in

Pros:
It´s non-euclidean!
controls are easy to learn.
sort enough to not become repetitive.

♥♥♥♥:

The Ski mission is imposible to play with VR + oculus controllers.
The controls need to be more responsive.
Shallow plot.

Summary, it works good as a short game/tech demo, looking forward to more games like this.
 
AꟻAЯ

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2022
The game met all my expectations:
Mind-screw 3D graphics ✓
Queasiness ✓

The only thing it lacked is a compelling plot and characters but those were not the things that drew me in in the first place. In fact the less dialogue there was the more I enjoyed exploring the twisted spaces.

I came upon the game by accident after trying to figure out what those non-Euclidean spaces mentioned in Lovecraft stories were supposed to look like. And I instantly fell in love with the game’s concept just for the exploration experience.

Which brings me to the obvious question: When are we gonna visit the city of R'lyeh? :)

Verdict:
Great game but have a vomit bag nearby, especially if you play it in VR.

A very unique title, a great exploration through atypical space!

If you're like me and get a little queasy, I found myself able to play this game for longer and more comfortably if I kept the map up and opened why walking around, thus focusing on the 2D map versus the 3D world as it moved around me. I definitely appreciate that the map stays open and has a slight transparency which allows you to play like that.

CringeCronge
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2022
I'd like to address this review to the developers of the game. This game is awesome. Thank you very much for the experience. I have a few pointers for improvements that I would like to propose.

1. Make the puzzles you've created resetable. Like the window cleaning mini-game. Please allow me to call down the lift so I can ride it up and down again. Also the laser mini-game in NEMO and the gopher mini-game at the ranch would benefit from this.
2. I would like the option to change my movement speed. Like a sprint button or something.
3. Please let me fast travel to all different worlds from the pauze menu.
4. Make it so that the fortuneteller tells you where to find the Vlogger and Businessperson. I talked to them about three or four times before I realized I needed them for the true ending. At that point I couldn't remember in what worlds I spoke to them. So I used a walkthrough and had to go to all the world again to look for them.
5. There is an NPC on a bench in the hub world who explains the different map projection you can use. It would be cool if after that conversation, the map shows you what projection you're looking at and what the special properties of that projection are.
6. If you are going to add more worlds, please make where we can explore 3D space. Maybe you could use the beach area to add a place where we could go diving. That way we could freely move up and down, to see how the would would change in those circumstances.
7. Also, I am really curious what a spherical world would look like if you can look at from the center. Like, there are two springboards, which you can use to jump to the other side of the world. But I would like to stand still halfway through. Maybe you can add a blue cactus to that world? That could make me large enough to see the world from that point of view.
8. And lastly, please explain the horizon in hyperbolic space to me. My intuition tells me that it ought to look like a straight line, like it does in real life, but it looks curved (like all straight lines do in hyperbolic space). The thing I don't understand is why the world doesn't fill up the space between where a straight horizon would be, and where the actual horizon is. I would think that this space would be filled up with objects that were exponentially further away. Maybe you could explain the horizon in a hyperbolic space in a video on your youtube channel. That would be greatly appreciated. Oh, and please address why the world looks spherical from high up, that doesn't really make sense to me. You'd think you could see farther away.

I want to thank you again for this amazing game. I wish you all good luck with your future projects. Lastly, I would like to say something that contains a spoiler:
I loved stage two of the final boss, where you are suddenly moving through euclidean space. That was incredibly disorienting, like I had been spinning in place for a while and suddenly came to a stop. That was genius.

137 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2022
I do have to go with what a lot of other people are saying. Gameplay-wise it's nothing special (walking around, talking to the different characters, some nifty tasks but most of the tasks aren't and literally nothing related to the plot points and where they go earn the game any points), but you're really here for the explorations of geometry. That's fun to play with and leads to most of the satisfaction you get from this. Well, that plus the visual style. Overall if you'll be amused by the geometries and the style (like I was) you'll like it. Otherwise skip. Though as an additional note the dev DID release the Unity extension (or whatever you call it) to make non-Euclidean worlds like this so people interested in making geometrically crazy games should absolutely play this and be inspired.
 
Logstar Go!
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 avril 2022
There are a lot of people saying that this game is a great tech demo, but not that stunning of a game. To be completely honest, I agree with that. However, do not by any means let that deter you from buying Hyperbolica. I'll admit, the story is a bit lacking, wondering around and looking at all the stunning visuals keeps me coming back.

I may be a little biased since before the game actually came out, I was following the dev logs on CodeParade's channel and was already a relatively long-time fan of CodeParade. Also, nerdy things having to do with math and geometry really pique my interest.

TL;DR: The story isn't much but the concept more than merits purchase.

As a side note, some people have said that you shouldn't buy this game unless it gets a price reduction, but I disagree. This is CodeParade's career we're talking about, and I think it's always a good idea to support indie devs even when they do one-off games like this.

belsaros
287 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2022
It's an interesting case with this game.
There is really no other game like it and I think for the visual and mathematical spectacle alone it deserves your time, this to me feels like what the next big step in gaming needs to be, we've gotten to near photo-realism with graphics so now we need to push the concept of what "graphics" even means. If you watched the devlogs on this game you wouldn't even begin to comprehend how hard this was to make, the dev had to invent his own system of space just to get the game to render properly forced into a system of space assumed by the Unity game engine, so you really won't find another game like this out there right now and it deserves commendation for the art that it is.

That said, outside of what a technological achievement this is, as a game, it's pretty boring. Before I go into it I'd like to state that I think the game really should have ended with you going back to the schooldesk to wake up and not at that stupidly easy NIL bossfight that comes after in which you can just circle the boss for the entire affair and win without effort. On a more general stance, the game can be beaten to near 100% in a matter of 2 or 3 hours, so even if the gameplay isn't your thing then you will likely get your fill of the spectacle in that time anyway. The gameplay can be boiled down to talking to NPCs A LOT and occasionally picking up "trinkets". The trinkets don't seem to really do anything other than give different outcomes to NPC interactions, and that seemed like a massive missed opportunity to me. For example, there's a drone racing minigame where I thought for sure by winning the race I'd get my own drone to freely explore the space and really marvel at perceiving the space from new angles, but I just got a calculator that like every other trinket is entirely useless unless you know the exact NPC that may or may not want a calculator at that point in time.
As for the NPC interaction which the game heavily relies on, I happen to know that the game uses a very clever system that puts markers within the text that NPCs read aloud to allow them to time and emote what they say, which can really enhance certain phrases and was worth the effort. That said, the actual writing the NPCs are given to say is pretty painful, it's trying WAYYYYYY too hard to be quirky, I felt like I was reading a scene kid's diary sometimes, I ended up skipping most of the dialogue and that coupled with the useless trinkets made for a pretty uneventful gameplay experience.
To be fair, there are SOME more involved bits of gameplay, like the gopher shootout in the farm area, but I don't think the trick to stunning the gophers was conveyed very well. The dialogue informs you that getting too close to the gophers gives them a chance to react to your blaster and you need to shoot from far away, which is understandable, but what they don't tell you is that the sound of the gun counts as "coming too close" AND that you need to be so far away that the gopher's projection in the world wraps around to be above you (another incredibly cool effect by the way, well done on that). It took me a long time to get past this part but props to being one of the best integrations of the weird perspective into active gameplay in the whole game.
There's also one section of the game that I can't fault the dev for putting in since it was a case of VERY poor timing, but let's just say there's a whole world of the game that feels very insensitive to current world issues at the time of this review's publishing, you'll know it when you see it, but trust me I do not blame the dev for this it's more a warning to the player.

But here's what it all comes down to in any form of entertainment: What you're getting for your money. At £13.50 (~$17.74), you're getting a one of a kind visual marvel, I can assure you, this game deserves praise for that. But to experience that, you have to play a game that can be mind-numbing if you don't care for the writing style. You will be offered unique collectables throughout the whole game, but their purpose ends at being collected. If you think you can be just as awed by this game through footage (think carefully about this), then go check out a playthrough and save the money. Otherwise, watch for yourself and play with the space through your own playthrough.
 
cute lil feller

aimawish
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2022
Awesome mind bending concept. Great art, witty storyline, and fun minigames that show off the quirks of irregular geometry. VR made me very motion sick, so I switched to non-VR and that was a lot more enjoyable. It's not a long game and left me wanting more! I beat the "Main Quest" in about two hours. Would love to see a Hyperbolica 2, or more games that incorporate some of these ideas.

Diving deeper... it takes some time to adjust to the different geometries... but when you do it is immensely satisfying. Playing through the main storyline will guide you through scenarios that help you understand how the hyperbolic (and spherical) worlds work. Would definitely like to jump back in sometime to replay the minigames and explore the environments more deeply. Maybe this would change with more time played but it's easy to get lost in hyperbolic space... it's hard to mentally map where you have been already and where you need to go. When there is a world designed with an orienting central landmark or a waypoint indicator, playability and enjoyment skyrockets. Of course this is used as a feature not a bug... one level is literally a maze. While spending time in bendy spaced Hyperbolica is fun, I am glad we live in this Euclidian world where you can orient yourself by looking up at the sky!

Hyperbolica, at its core, is a game about geometry. About what happens in worlds without Euclid's parallel postulate. It's a game that messes with your concept of space and makes you re-evaluate the world around you and how it works.

It's a trippy game with a good story and it's well worth picking up.

Évaluation publiée le 26 mars 2022
In my opinion, the game is very easy and short, but I think it could even help many people to understand what this game wants to tell. It's very, very impressive what this game does and how well it works. And the engine that was made for this game is open-source and available for everyone to use in their own projects, which could help many people to make their own adventures in non-euclidean worlds
 
ТрапоЛино
0

Évaluation publiée le 26 mars 2022
An interesting game with a truly unique concept. The game's story is fairly short, but there's plenty to explore and do. Best played in small doses as the warping visuals of non-euclidean space can induce headaches if played for an extended period of time. I can only imagine how disorienting this must be in VR.

Definitely worth a play through.

candyman
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mars 2022
Haven't finished it yet but have been exploring it for hours in both flatscreen and VR. It gets a positive review from me because of hyperbolic geometry of space, experiencing this by itself was easily worth double the game's price. I did feel that below that the gameplay itself is kinda mediocre, so far mostly talking to NPCs and finding your way around. Protip from a fellow game dev: next time hire actual writers to write the dialogue :D

I've seen other reviews refer to "minigames" in Hyperbolica, but I don't think it's fair to call them that, as they do not abandon the core gameplay and game world in order to waste your time with a inferior short gaming experience, but they instead happen inside of the main game world and are really experiments with different types of gameplay inside of hyperbolic space, and are easily the best part of the game.

I'm having endless fun in Hyperbolica just walking around in "90 degree circles" around a patch of trees. Something like that may sound boring on paper, but in Hyperbolica it's mindblowing. It's one of those things you just can't imagine until you experience it for yourself, my favorite category of experiences.
 
Eagleshadow
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2022
A fun time in short bursts when you're playing in VR. In fact: I highly suggest you try VR if you can just for the experience. If you get motion sick (or if VR-specific technical bugs are too much for you), you can switch to desktop. There's no shame in that, and the game's still fun. (And trippy!)
The game's short, sweet, and impressive technically, mathematical conceptually, thematically, not to mention the writing. Gameplay is simple in the overworld but varied in various activities you come across, often making the absolute most of hypberbolic space.
Only gripes I have is that I think VR should realign HUD stuff to the direction you're facing instead the "front" of your playspace, and that Steam VR doesn't overlay properly into it; so when you exit, Steam VR still thinks it's running. I think both of these can be patched, however, and I'll update my review if I hear that these get fixed.
Update: Oh, the UI hud issue got fixed, and I forgot to update for over a month! Whoops!

0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2022
***Recommendation with a BIG asterisk.***
Very cool game with a very cool concept, and it's one that I've been looking forward to trying out for a long time. Unfortunately, moving around in this interesting world is a bit too disorienting to my inner ear and leaves me feeling somewhere between a little dizzy and very motion-sick. I've never felt this way playing a game before, not even in VR (I tried this game with a keyboard and mouse, NOT in VR by the way).
Props to CodeParade for making such an interesting game, but I would only recommend this game to those who know for sure that it would't make them feel ill.

0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2022
*A flawed yet facinating game*
i watch code parade its how all of us got here seeing the insane visuals and work that went into it i was facinated and bought it. and it did not dissapoint there was everything i expected. mind bending impossible spaces and many fun ways to use that space. the writing while not really making for a terribly creative story has a lot of funny character moments. CS math and geometry puns galore. however the gameplay was severerly lacking. it felt incomplete and short at times. the gameplay included (minor spoilers) a maze, a puzzle, a platforming section, a thinly veiled fetch quest with only story to make it intresting and a veichle section. some side missions have interesting scenarios but no truly engaging gameplay. this in my non educated opinion shows this game was developed by a brilliant programer and a competent writer but also by an untrained game designer. however i cant not aprreciate the creativity and funny writing on display and while i have finished the game i havent 100% it i can still recommend it.
 
almog991
268 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2022
This game is absolutely breathtakingly wonderful. It's easily one of the best games I've ever played, and there's nothing hyperbolic about that statement.
The story is charming and actually has a very well-designed mystery.
The characters are lovable and the writing is beautifully nerdy and fun.
The actual gameplay is so fun. Hyperbolic geometry makes the simple act of exploring feel weird and unique.
Also, the game has a very well designed completion mechanic, which helps you find everything without taking anything out of the experience of exploration.
The final challenge has a difficulty scaling that's incredibly clever and works so well with the rest of the game.
The only real complaint I have, which is an incredibly small one, is that there's one type of geometry that would have been incredibly fun and clever to see implemented, and it would have been very thematically fitting with a certain entity in the game.

Español:
La historia es bastante básica y solo la veo como un hilo conductor para disfrutar la experiencia de recorrer un mundo confuso y visualmente atractivo. Dicho esto, el precio es muy accesible y tiene suficiente bromas nerd como para haberme hecho reír, así que lo recomiendo.

English:
The story is pretty basic and I only see it as a means to enjoy the experience of discovering a confusing and visually appealing non-Euclidean world. That said, it's affordably priced and has enough nerdy jokes to make me laugh, so I'd recommend it.

Platurt
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2022
Overall a Decent Game.
Ive been keeping up with the games devlogs and i was excited for the release of this.
First impressions on entering the game was that the story was a bit on the generic side.
Hearing youve woken up in this hidden area of the VR universe and your first objective is to acquire some random crystals that are just lying around everywhere, and nobody else has thought to do this, is a bit of a distracting thought as you progress through the game. The story does improve as the game progresses, adding more detail and hinting to a bigger, more advanced narrative. I haven't finished the game, so i dont know if there will be some big twist at the end that makes the whimsical story have a bit more of an impact, but keeping the story feeling like its from a 15 minute stickman flash game for the first half an hour, might drive some people away.

On the technical end, this game is a work of art. Ive seen the devlogs and so i understand how much work went into the backend of this project. The amount of space that gets compressed when working on a hyperbolic plane is incredibly disorienting and you can loose your sense of direction very easily. The spherical geometry was, if not the most impressive, certainly the trippiest geometry type ive seen so far. However, some of the puzzles and activities didnt really require hyperbolic geometry to work, or they didnt use hyperbolic geometry to innovate on the ideas. For example the snowy area had almost nothing to do with hyperbolic geometry apart from looking cool when you take the trebuchet and having to aim funny during the snowball fight. And the art gallery, was just a cool platformer that didnt really take advantage of the games main gimmick. This is in contrast to the maze, which uses the hyperbolic geometry very effectively to completely confuse you, by making paths appear to cross over each other even though they simply occupy a different area in hyperbolic space.
These are only minor complaints though, as while it dosent change the ideas behind the activities, it changes the visuals so much. Everything is so hard to navigate if you only obey traditional laws of navigation and direction, so the game forces you to think in an entirely different way. Its such a fun mechanic, and i love the behind the scenes code that went into making it all work.
The dialogue is entertaining and witty. Almost all the jokes are topical, and the characters all seem to have some background to them. The little mini-quests you can do with reoccurring characters is something nice to look out for and keeps the world feeling whole.
In terms of VR... we have no VR. I do have a VR headset, but the VR system is in its early alpha and its so completely broken for WMR users. I cant get past the main menu and the performance is awful. I expect this will be fixed in a few days.

Nitpicks:
- The game does not have many graphics improvements for high-end, mid-range, or even low-end users. The game is fabulously optimised, but i wish there were some more graphics options for those of us with anything better than the equivalent of a chromebook.
- The position of the character is not saved on exiting and entering the world, you get reset to the level spawn every load.
- The transition between levels is lacklustre. Walking up to the weird portal and clicking it is really off putting. Walking into it and fading to a white transition with the logo would have been nice, or the game could use a dynamic loading system to load the new area and unload the main area to make the transition between world and level completely seamless.
- The map is a little big. Maybe a size slider in the gameplay settings would help.
- The gophers dont match the games artstyle.

Overall, im enjoying this game a lot. This is from a guy whos only about halfway through and so far i think ive got my moneys worth.
 
CaramelTurbine
30 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

The technical achievement drew me, but the game is very under-challenging. It’s sad that more interesting puzzles were not created. If your unfamiliar with Riemannian geometry the gameplay should be briefly novel. If you are familiar, I would skip this game. 5/10

ty.singh828
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2022
This is a masterpiece. It's a shame it only took 2h to complete the game, but I can understand that designing puzzles for Hyperbolica is much harder than for any game confined to a euclidean space (pretty much every other game).
To be fair though, I didn't get every collectable, only about 40% of them, so there is a bit more gameplay and story for me to discover.

On a technical stand point, performance was great, I saw no glitches, gameplay was fluid and the non-euclidean spaces were perfectly represented. Props to the dev.

On a more general design stand point, this was an experience as much as a game. Puzzles were just mind-bending enough to get me out of the euclidean space comfort, but not too much as to have me completely lost. I find that the drone race was very useful to get a general idea of the available levels, but if I'm being honest I feel like he could have been playing out in the center park instead of where he is now (maybe close to the caravan). As for the map, I only really used the stereographic projection as I didn't find any real use for the other two, but that's a really minor thing.

All in all this game is really fun and puzzles are simple yet elegant in the way they force you to think outside our very euclidean based comfort. The story and side stories are also nice to follow and made me (who never speaks with NPCs) want to interact with everyone (which I haven't yet because of the sheer number of characters).

It is a cool techdemo, not very expensive either. I wouldnt say it is worth it if you're not going to play it in VR tho.
It is not a very long game, and its only gimmick is the non-euclidean geometry, however I would say it is worth a try in VR just to see how weird it looks, and how quickly you become lost. Our brains DID NOT evolve to deal with spaces like these.
And weirdly enough, it did not cause me any nausea in VR.

The only parts in the dialogues that caught my interest were the ones actually explaining the mechanics of the hyperbolic world. Every joke is followed by expressions like "I'm not good at jokes". The game even could be better without any dialogues or quests, with pure exploration or something. What I'm trying to say is that, other than the world geometry and good music, there is nothing special about the game, and the dialogues only serve as an obstacle to enjoying Hyperbolica.

SchlobinExE
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2022
Expérience courte mais excellente.

Les + :
- L'originalité : Tout le jeu est basé sur sa géométrie non-euclidienne qui donne une impression très bizarre et un monde inhabituel. C'est très bien exploité dans le jeu par des phases de gameplay courtes (quelques minutes) qui durent exactement le temps nécessaire pour en profiter sans pour autant s'en lasser.
- Le gameplay : Simple mais efficace. En général on ne peut que se déplacer mais on a parfois à notre disposition d'autres outils pour un court instant. Le jeu a un côté très "léché", bien fini : pas de bug, des hitboxes précises...
- La musique : Sympa et en cohérence avec le jeu. Mon seul reproche est que le monde "principal" aurait peut-être mérité plusieurs musiques, parce qu'on y passe beaucoup de temps.
- L'écriture : Puisque le jeu consiste beaucoup à se balader et parler aux PNJs, il y a beaucoup d'humour et de remarques méta. On a aussi une certaine cohérence de l'univers ; on entend souvent parler d'un endroit quand on est dans un autre endroit, ce qui renforce l'impression d'un monde cohérent plutôt qu'un hub et des niveaux déconnectés. Le "scénario" bien que très simple fonctionne, et la fin est assez surprenante.
- Les graphismes : Simples et avec peu de polygones, ils font sens avec le reste du jeu.

Les - :
- La durée de jeu : Fini en moins de 4h à 100%

Conclusion :
Une excellente expérience. Le genre de jeu qu'on ne fait qu'une fois mais dont on se souvient. Le prix peut sembler élevé pour un jeu qui ne durera qu'une poignée d'heures mais le principe-même du jeu est suffisamment original pour que ça vaille le coup.
 
ThePlatypus[FR]

The Oren Summoner
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2022
finished the mian game after a bit under 4 hours

I still have some archievements and trinkets left to find, this is a game with simple yet interesting mechanics

the characters are funny and intriging and most of the minigames explore the strange geometry in ways i didn't quite expect, my favorites would be the labyrinth and the skate-waiter quest for the main quests, and the laser puzzle, treasure chest and rocket skis for miniquests

I had been following this little project for a while now and i gotta say that it was worth the wait, though i do have some little nitpicking of complaints. some minigames would benefit from an extra UI, like the rockets skis in wich it would be helpful to know how long do you still have to go, or the hit a mole gun needing an crosshair, and the main quest of the snow world, while having an okay story, has very repetitive gameplay and lastly, it is quite easy to get headaches or dizzyness (something i think is inevitable with the geometry involved)

overall, it was a greatly enjoyable experience 8.5/10
 
TempestAxolotl
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2022
The concept and tech behind this game are wonderful, but the game itself feels exceedingly short, unpolished, generally incomplete, and often, downright frustrating. It took 5 hours to 100% clear the game, and over a quarter of this time was spent trying to complete a single task in a single level ( completing the ice ski trinket ). I ended up having to community posts to clarify what the task actually was, which is extremely annoying given that a single line of dialog or an in game timer could have prevented this. Perhaps even worse than this is that the game locks an achievement behind VR mode - it should not need to be said that this is extremely unprofessional, CodeParade's decision to do this actively treats players who have paid for the game but do not own VR as lesser than solely because they have not paid hundreds of dollars for computer accessory that does not fundamentally change the game in concept, story, or gameplay.
 
DekuSapling
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2022
I love this idea to use Non-Euclidean space in a game. CodeParade says "It's a difficult concept to explain, and first-hand experience really is the best way to understand and build an intuition about these interesting geometries. Hyperbolica was created specifically for this purpose, to break the mold and to have a fun experience in an alternative universe different from our own." (steam store quote) and this game does deliver on this experience. Sure some "mini games" could be a bit more refined in some ways, but i guess that comes down to personal preferences and talking bad about the game because of SOME unrefined things in SOME "mini games" would be cherry-picking. Overall it's a good and solid product that is able to teach you about the odd geometry of hyperbolic space and spherical space, which is what it claims to do.

1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2022
Don't ignore the sign post pointing to all the areas. It's in the grass area where you first spawn.

Cute game, runs well, it's exactly what it looks like in the trailers. You get to do little games like roller skating orders out to tables in a restaurant with infinitely distant corners, and while the games and puzzles seem easy on paper the new twists on space add their own challenge. It's almost like experiencing life in a non-euclidean world.

If you want to know more about it, the dev has a YouTube channel where you can watch the development of the game over time.

cowleyeben33
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2022
Non-Euclidean geometry is not something I know much about. I stumbled into the developer's devlog channel on YouTube and got hyped up to this game by it.

So I bought this game day one and finished it day one as well. But even though I would recommend this game, for the unique experience, I don't think it's a particularly good game.

The part I was particularly looking forward to exploring was how to be spatially aware in this kind of game. I found it uniquely fun that even in a huge space, it took very little time to go anywhere, when going directly. And I was actually scared to get lost in the corners of Infinity Café before I realized how it worked. The most mind-bending one was what I believe is a spherical world where the things furthest away appear biggest, which was really interesting.

But the gameplay was more disappointing than I expected. Besides being a simple adventure game about collecting trinkets and following a story, the game hosts a series of minigames, many of which are optional. I liked a few of them but mostly they felt like they weren't playtested by anyone else than the developer(s?).
The final "boss" was also very poor for gameplay, as I had no idea what was going on for a while and once I got a clue, I found that the optimal strategy was weird ( closely circling the boss ) and made me heavily visually obstructed without many breaks to enjoy the scenery or experience.
And perhaps I am too spoiled by the expectations from gaming in general but I was bothered by there not being a quest tracker, so if you missed out on important information in a dialogue, you might have to resort to tediously going through every single NPC to get a clue of where to go next. And at this point in time I am missing 3 trinkets that I doubt I'll ever get because I only have a single clue of what to look for ( tea cup/party ) and I feel like I've been everywhere twice already, not to mention that the main hint-provider ( caravan magician
- which I don't believe is ever told to the player explicitly either by the way) has nothing left to tell me. So it's just too tedious.

I also really hope that the developer eventually includes previewing sound effect levels in the settings. I had turned it down beforehand but when starting the main quest in De Sitter Farms there's a REALLY loud sound effect (which might be the only occurrence of sound effects in the game as far as I can tell) and it got me really startled with no immediate reason for it, so if that is not changed in updates, I'd recommend putting it to less than 40% and then you'll have the opportunity to adjust it upwards after that, for the active use of the gun.

I hope the game is polished a bit further, including the movement, gameplay and quality of life things. But otherwise, if nothing else, this might just serve as a platform for new games to explore 3D non-Euclidean spaces. I'd definitely be happy to see more of those.
 
Muskar
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2022
Hyperbolica is an awesome game, in and of itself, even before you get to delve into it's non-euclidean mechanics! The characters and stories are charming and heartfelt, and you can tell a lot of the game has been derived from the developer's personal experiences, albeit with certain impossible twists. The hyperbolic nature does take some time to get used to, but the charm of the worlds still amazes me even after beating the game 3 times and 100%ing it (minus the playing in actual VR achievement ;-;). I'd highly recommend and absolutely say it's worth the 14 dollar price tag.

Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022

Krysoclaus
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2022
I liked it, but I can see the reasons why people would dislike it.

From a tech standpoint Hyperbolica does something that very few games have tried, and thats display it's world using non-euclidian geometry.

Pros:

The World and it's design were nice. It was cool to see all the different areas the world had and how something that might seem typical in a normal game changes to this games rules.

The music was really nice, each areas music felt like it belonged there and none of the music seemed out of place.

The graphics. For me while a bit disorienting didn't make me sick at all.

The ♥♥♥♥:

The Story. This one isn't my biggest complaint since I knew going into this game that it probably wouldn't be that long or in depth. Heck games with Short Stories or no story at all are enjoyable. But this games story felt like it needed to be fleshed out. It feels like a revised rough draft. The Ideas for the story are there but not fleshed out.

The NPCs, there's only a small handful of npcs that you actually need to interact with to beat the game. So while it's cool to talk to the NPCs it feels like it's pointless to even do so.

The ending which I'm trying not to spoil here felt like a let down. It introduced a mechanic not really seen in other parts of the game so when you get to it, it can throw you off because you won't know what exactly to do or have an idea of what to do.

Overall I enjoyed the game but it feels like more could have been done. A lot of games tend to suffer from feature creep but this game feels like it doesn't have enough features.

I knew what I was going into but I know a lot of people won't.

My personal rating for this game is a 4/5.
The mechanics and style are there but it's still missing substance.

If you don't want to pay full price then I would highly recommend getting the game if it goes on sale. I got more enjoyment out of this game than some games that are trying to charge $60
 
Themicrocheeze

393 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
As a math geek, just wandering through the world is entertaining, but it eventually wears thin. As others have stated, the game felt much like a tech demo: it does not have very much interactive gameplay elements to speak of and can be beaten in less than 2 hours. The dialog while at times funny sometimes felt like it was trying too hard to be cutesy or clever. I find that the various aspects of hyperbolic geometry were underexplored, and some challenges felt like it would hardly be different in Euclidean geometry. If the mere prospect of moving through a 3D hyperbolic world excites you for its own sake, then I give this game a recommendation, but don't hold your breath for immersive gameplay.
