KrabGor
688 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
The main reason to buy this game is if you want to play around in non-euclidean spaces. The game certainly delivers on that front and for that reason alone I'll recommend the game. However, once you get past the novelty of the experience, the game isn't very fun.

Most of the game you're walking around trying to find a certain collectible or a specific person to talk to. This can be difficult at times because its easy to get lost in hyperbolic space and you often don't even know who your supposed to talk to or where you should be looking. This is exacerbated by most of the characters being very similar in appearance, essentially forcing you to talk to everyone to figure out which ones actually do anything.

There are also activities/mini-games; however, all of them feel very clunky. They also throw in a few puzzles that try to force you to understand the non-euclidean space, but they end up becoming too easy or brute-force-able. Additionally, many of the puzzles and activities are easy to miss due to the same reasons mentioned before. I had beaten the game without doing the drone race, if it weren't for the trailer I wouldn't have gone back to the game to try and find it, which is unfortunate because its one of the better activities.

Also the story is not particularly interesting or compelling. Now I really don't think anybody was planning on buying this game for its storytelling but I thought I should mention it.

That being said, I think the game delivers on expectations. It allows you to explore non-euclidean spaces and it gives you quite a few trippy moments. For this reason it seems like it would be great in VR. It's a bit unfortunate that the gameplay is lacking. However, it's also understandable because of the small size of the team and the technological challenge of getting hyperbolic space to work.

Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
TL;DR - Although this game isn't that big. It is one of the most unique I have ever played.

Played only on PC. Not VR

Gameplay:
• Pretty simple and easy to understand.
• Puzzles are not hard to figure out and even if you get stuck you can always go to the oracle.
Visuals:
• It’s hyperbolic.
• Shading is nice and simple just like the environment.
• Love the different types of environments like the farm and infinity café.
Overall I am happy with my purchase. I can see myself revisiting this game to show to friends and family as an example of hyperbolic space just like I do with 4D toys.

Update:
Tried it in VR and suprisingly I didn't get sick at all. Tbh I don't tippically get sick from VR games, but I thought I might become sick with the wacky geometry. All in all it is fun to see it at play in VR. Especcialy launching yourself in the air that messes up your whole persception.
 
rubeste
582 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
Hyperbolica is like no game I have ever played.
To be immersed in this brain-bending, disorienting, non-Euclidian world for a few hours and to have the opportunity to explore it is such a unique experience. I don't think the videos or images can possibly do it justice. It's like going through the looking glass - there aren't adequate words to describe how strange and disorienting it is.

The actual gameplay is clever. The story is lighthearted and engaging, and the puzzles complement the unique aspects of the game world. It's fairly short - consider it more of a once-in-a-lifetime experience than a game with a lot of replayability. Definitely worth the price I paid. And will have to play more to really wrap my head around the fascinating properties of the game world.
 
zabaduba
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
Hyperbolica is a fun game, that tries to teach how non-euclidean geometries work. Instead of just SAYING that say... a hyperbolic square's 4 angles are 60 degrees, they point it out and you get to walk around and experience what that is like.

Now, I'm not going to sugar coat this. If you get motion sick easily this is NOT the game for you. I normally don't experience that and I sometimes have to cut my playtime... and I'm not playing VR. That being said I noticed if I'm well rested verses playing late at night I tend to handle that better. Your millage may vary.

That aside, this game is very funny and quite clever. It may be a bit niche but if you're considering the game enough to see what others thought (reading this review), I would say buy it. Its a good game.

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
Ok wow... so first off, space is bigger in most places, or small and curving in on itself in some, it took a little time to get used to but the non-euclidean space gimmick is pretty awesome and well implemented, its uniquely mind bending!

On the gameplay side things can be a bit basic, the controls are okay but its at times not obvious how some quests exploit the non-euclidean space, and it can be tedious to figure out what you have to do.

Don't expect too much from the story, it is slow in the beginning and simplistic BUT it picks up in an awesome direction at the end (also regarding gameplay and graphics).

-- edit --
just had to add this thought; i think hyperbolica is the most accesible implementation so far, of a game set in curved spaces

Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2022
You already know if you won't like this game.

I just finished 100%, this game is basically what you'd expect. The dev put a stupid amount of effort into the engine (You rotate with platforms when you stand on them!), and made a game around that. It's a solo effort, set in an unfamiliar space, and the dev made the most of what was basically an experiment. Incredible results all things considered.

Play this if you want to see what hyperbolic space is like firsthand, with some light story, platforming, and other minigames to complement that idea.

Play this if you want to support experimentation in game design.

Dude programmed in a deSitter space! And shooting mechanics! And racing! Mostly it's just walking around a hyperbolic space, getting a bit confused, and talking to surprisingly well-written characters.

steventrouble
376 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
This is a not a typical indie game. There is no existing tool in market to create hyperbolic and spherical geometry in games. Lots of effort and original work went into it. This makes the game worth its price. Also, I recommend giving it to kids. They will find the geometry fascinating.


However, due to being the very first of its kind, it is still a very immature game. The game was over before I even knew it. The story is super short and quite cheesy. Butt that should not have mattered. The big deal with this game is the geometry. It is a great environment for puzzles and platforming. Sadly, that potential has been wasted. I wish it had more puzzles based around non-linear geometry. Maybe more will be added in future.

Another issue is, some of the transitions break the non-euclidean illusion. The most obvious one is the jumping pad in the De Sitter Farm. It is very obvious that the game is forcing you to look away.

Edit: I agree with Shiba that there is too much talking. Finishing the game took me over three hours, but if the extra talking was not there, it would have been finished in under two hours. I am looking for quest givers, and having to talk to everyone and dealing with the dialogues is driving me nuts way more than the geometry. We seriously need some markers on the heads of quest givers.

Also, where is my achievement for finishing the rocket ski quest? That was torture. We deserve an achievement for that. It could be something like, "Earned the Safety Tie"
 
Subhasis
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
This game was on my wishlist from the moment I first came across the devlogs on YouTube, and I must say I am not disappointed. There are some issues, and some missing modern QoL features, but for the most part I give them a pass—I came for a trippy curved reality, and I got a trippy curved reality!

So since I've already told you the major good point, I guess I should list a few of the bad as well...

• Viewing the map takes up a huge portion of the center of the screen. A mini-map (which I hope can be added in an update) would make learning to navigate the extra space more intuitive, by letting you see the map and your goal at the same time. As it is, the map is almost more hindrance that help during the times you need it most—in a new area.

• There are no quest markers in general, so you WILL wander aimlessly. I expect this in a game of this length, however, so I give it a pass in most cases—besides, the point is to learn to get around in this expanse, and giving you precise pointers to your next goal would be handing you that reward for zero mental effort. However, in the cafe minigame they are absolutely necessary and much appreciated while they are there. The drone game similarly has rings to show you your path, and something along those lines in the ski course would have helped a lot with frustration there.

• Some would argue the plot is overly shallow and ultimately meaningless. I would disagree—characters all over this world drop tiny hints toward pieces of lore that add up over time and paint an impression that something deeper is going on, just enough so that when the plot twist is dropped on you, it doesn't feel like it came out of nowhere. That's my take on it and your mileage will vary, but I was satisfied with it.

• This didn't affect me, but it's been pointed out that following some puzzle hints requires full color vision. There's currently no way around it and it could make those portions prohibitively difficult for those with color blindness.

Overall, I'd recommend the experience if you're a game and mathematics fan. If you're on the fence, maybe wait for a sale—or maybe just take the plunge! I usually wait myself, but I was so excited for the release that I jumped all in on this one!
 
Wintering Goose

Played this on launch. It was so much fun. Pretty quick game, but I can't blame it; there are so many NPCs and so much unique dialogue. Finding all the trinkets was a fun but not very difficult challenge. I loved the NEMO platforming puzzle. It's a very trippy game. Sometimes hard to wrap your brain around. Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
The story is a bit short, the plot is a bit plain, but the level design ! Ho my !

Clearly you're not here to engage on a 50h+ emotional and vibrant story but to blow your mind with a glimpse of what hyperbolic plane can feel.
Yet npc feel well polished and characterized enough, thumbs up on the Rap battle that truelly make me laugh
Hyperbolica will give you a much "closer" experience than other games of the genre like hyperRogue and crush by a far margin other so-called "non euclidian" game like portal, antichamber etc... Not on the plot or the puzzle side, no, simply by its game engine.
I see hyperbolica as a pionner for other hyperbolic theme game,
After playing it i simply crave for a true puzzle game that use hyperbolic space !
Or simply a multiplayer sandbox

If you want to experience hyperbolic geometry, try this game, otherwise walk away
 
BenCaddyro
126 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
This game is great and well done. I think it gives a really unique experience and manages to make you experience hyperbolic and spherical spaces in a really unique fashion.

It's not a triple-A game, it's an indie game and you have to have that in mind. There is a lot of talking and walking, some mini games and that's about it for the gameplay. It's clear that all that is just an excuse and what provides the experience is just moving through the world: Walking into the labyrinth of the forest is super unintuitive, in the infinite caffe you get lost and feel small, just jumping on a trampolin is a visual treat. I think that's the point of the game, that you get a little lost experiencing the hyperbolic space, and then you go to a place with spherical geometry and it feels so different and everything so close, the contrast is really good and I can explain it to you but what is cool is you doing it. It's not the same looking someone walking in a weird geometry than you doing it and trying to build a mental map of it which seems impossible.

After finishing the game I was left with a feeling that I wanted to do some more stuff with this, I would love to see more spherical worlds and more intricate levels and interactions with NPCs, that's because the game has a really solid ground behind it but it has really simple gameplay.

I 100% recommend it, the experience this provides is really unique and I would love to see even deeper exploration of this concept with crazier gameplay.
 
4Robato
0

Beautiful and surreal. Chill exploration of an alien space filled with deceptively ordinary things.

Sum
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
I have followed the development of this game from the early days and I have to say the end product lived up to my hype.

The base story can be completed really fast but that is not how you're supposed to play this game. It's interesting to talk to everyone, complete all the different little minigames and discover small bits of the story hidden in these details. I'm not saying it's masterfully done, but for a game that is built around the idea of hyperbolic geometry it's not bad. Furthermore I think the story itself is nice, even if it's a bit minimal.

The minigames themselves are pretty basic, but that's good because the novelty comes from how these games behave differently in non-euclidean geometry. However, it would be nice if all minigames were replayable.

The hyperbolic geometry itself is really interesting to explore and experience. It's one thing to understand you don't get to the same place going forward then right or right then forward and another to see it first hand. On the other hand spherical geometry is probably something I won't be able get enough of. It would be nice if there were more spherical levels.

One thing missing from the game is an area with euclidean geometry to be able to compare the experience with the non-hyperbolic area. The game engine supports it, there is at least one scene where it is used.

Another addition that would be most welcome is workshop support for custom levels, but it's understandable that was not a goal for release. Still, here's hoping it might happen in an update or a sequel.
 
Rotslaughter

There was a brief period where my eyes hurt a bit, but I can't say for sure if it was the game or how late at night it was when I played.

61 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
at first I was worried that the game wouldn't be fun, a cool concept on paper that doesn't work in reality, but that's not what I was met with. This experience was much more immersive than I expected a game specifically about defying reality to be. The game makes great use of its premise for many different fun minigames and, suprising to me at first, a well thought-out story. i also love the attention to detail this game has. every single little robot person floating around has their own unique dialogue which often changes in response to your actions. there are so many little things strewn about this world which you can miss due to the hard-to-see scale of Hyperbolica, but are an absolute joy to discover. it really encourages you to not fly through the game but to really soak it in and immerse yourself in its world. the game also does a good job at making these interactions useful. if you talk to the characters in the middle of a task, each one will give you a tiny hint on how to complete it. the game does a good job of explaining enough of this strange new world that you don't get lost, while not giving too much away unless the player needs it. all of these really help immerse you in the world which is really amazing considering how alien this world feels. I love the concept and i hope to see more games like this, questioning the things we think are always true

Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
this game is seriously trippy. even when i close out the game it feels weird seeing parallel lines irl staying parallel. the story is simplistic, but that's because the game is meant to showcase the concept of actually playing in a non-euclidean space sandbox, unlike portal puzzels. and the charming characters and story make up for the short length anyways. the only real problems i have with this game are you can't back out of dialogue easily and you can't speed-date cornelius

idk if it's worth $17 usd, but i don't use a vr set. so maybe it is worth it for that experience. if i ever get access to vr ill def try this game in vr

oh yeah. the developer has a youtube channel where they do other cool and nerdy stuff
 
bluee
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
Something to keep in mind when buying this game:

The main focus of this game is not the story, the story can be rushed through in less than an hour if you really want to.
Hyperbolica is an exploration game where you explore its non-euclidean geometry, interact with its characters, and try to unpack the world's secrets through minigames and dialogue. If that isn't your thing, your probably won't like this game.

I did like this game.

The world of Hyperbolica is just like the geometry its named after. Everything seems small, but by continuing to explore you'll find the vast amount of gameplay and easter eggs the devs have crammed into this charming little world.

I spent 3 1/2 hours exploring this world before actually finishing the main story, and I'll definitely be coming back to find everything I missed on my first playthrough!
 
johnisahamster
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
A charming game that reveals a surprising amount of depth when you take the time to look around.

The story is simple, if a bit lacking, but it never really needed to be elaborate, considering the game's whole purpose is to demonstrate hyperbolic and spherical geometry and all their quirks in a digestible, lighthearted format. The locales, the minigames, they all exist to show the player how different the world would look and function in non-Euclidean space.
A lot of work and care has clearly gone into the setting itself; the props and locations are very neat and polished, deliberately designed to demonstrate various aspects of non-Euclidean geometry, such as the warping of height and the complete lack of parallel lines. The world also has a fair amount of lore to it, much of which you never really interact with outside of NPC dialogue, but remains prominent while you play.
Not to mention the number of coding challenges that come with making a non-Euclidean game to begin with! If you're at all curious about how a game like this could ever be created, check out CodeParade's video series on Youtube documenting the game's development and explaining just how bizarre hyperbolic and spherical geometry can be.

All in all, Hyperbolica is a short, fun romp through non-Euclidean space that's easy to lose yourself in. If you enjoy math, computer science, or slight dizziness after an hour or two, definitely pick this game up!
 
bomb

Hyperbolica is a wonderful experience as a whole, and I especially loved the ongoing thought-stimulating discussions that existed within the worlds. Well worth the hype, and I hope the creator and all who contributed are proud to have brought this brilliant and unique concept so far.

If you are not math-brained... eh? Probably can't recommend. Unless DLC comes out (full racing game, pls).

374 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
TL;DR: The game is very mediocre, but you should buy it regardless.

I've been anxiously following this game's development from the start and bought it the instant I woke up today, but after playing it, I feel that it has a lot of glaring flaws. First, the game would probably have don better as a puzzle game than a fetch quest game, and while there are a few puzzle quests here and there, the majority of the game doesn't even take advantage of it's premise that much.

By far the most glaring issue is the maze quest, where you need to figure out where in said maze a particular Plot Token is. But then one particular NPC outright *marks where it is on your map*, which to me seems like if Monty Hall just flat-out told you which door the car was behind.

But despite all the game's flaws, when you consider that the development team had a grand total of *two* people, it's honestly impressive that the game manages to even be as decent as it is. But you should buy it anyway, because the gaming industry would greatly benefit from this game and it's coding wizardry getting pushed into the spotlight, because then more developers with more manpower and resources at their disposal can improve and build off of what CodeParade made here. Heck, if this game does well enough, maybe CodeParade himself will have the funds to hire a bigger team and make a sequel or DLC that corrects the flaws of this game.

atimholt
467 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
A puzzle-sandbox game with an interesting gimmick. I don't know if I would buy it at the current price (more than 15$), but if the price goes down or there's a sale, I say it would be worth it.

Pros:
-I've never seen a game that does non-euclidean space before, and this game is all about that. If you like interacting with a truly unique world, the game is for you.
-The game is pretty charming and laid-back, with more of a focus on story, worldbuilding, and immersive tasks than brain-bending puzzles. It's more of a walking simulator with some interactive quests than a puzzle game.
-The game really does take advantage of its non-euclidean design whenever it can. It's clear the designer put a lot of thought into ways that non-euclidean space changes things you wouldn't even think about!

♥♥♥♥:
-The game's pace is pretty slow for a game this short, and you spend way more time just meandering around the world than doing puzzles. If you were looking for a true puzzle game, you'll be disappointed.
-I wish this game had more guidance. I know it's a game about walking around a world, but there's know way to know if you've talked to an NPC before or explored a space before. I found myself spending a lot of time confused about whether I had done something before.
-It's a bit of a nitpick, but I wish this game had faster and more dynamic movement. This game's non-euclidean environment kind of goes to waste a lot of the time, as your movement is pretty slow and constrained. The roller skating, the drone, and the end are my favorite parts of the game because they buck this trend!

Overall, this game is a dancing bear. It's really interesting because it does something unprecedented, but it doesn't really stand out besides that. In my opinion, it's worth playing, but not really worth 100%ing. If I had to give the developer a recommendation, it's to make like, a DLC map pack for this game that really engages with its "puzzle game" potential for it some more. I am not disappointed I bought this game, but I really think it has so much untapped potential as a concept. Best of luck to them for future development in this space!

This game is an incredibly fun little adventure in a pretty big world. You can see how much love and effort was put into making this into an unforgettable experience. kubstoff
131 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2022
I've been following the Hyperbolica project since its announcement so buying and playing this was a nobrainer for me.

I've enjoyed this short experience (a little bit around 90 minutes to complete), and looking at the available achievements, chances are I'm going to come back to hunt the rest, possibly in VR. As a math nerd, game taking place in hyperbolic world was certainly entertaining and possibly even educational.

That being said, Hyperbolica is a still more of a short tech demo, rather than a full game. "quests" are not really visible and discerning between important NPCs and those that merely provide flavor text is impossible, but there's only so many of characters you can interact with. None of the conversations were particular noteworthy, except the snow world questline, which was fun, but the snowball fight was immensely frustrating.

During the final boss, at first I died without knowing why (hard to orientate yourself) and the then beat it by cheesing it without any real skill involved.

Final words: I've still enjoyed this and will be looking forward to more projects by CodeParade, Hyperbolica related or not. However the price tag is rather high for its length, but I'm glad I could support the creator.

What a cute little game: Simple, enjoyable and cool.
I got used to the hyperbolic space pretty quickly adn that amazed me (i thought it would be VERY confusing).
I wish it had more verciality; it's very flat. But i guess verticality is a problem in hyperbolic space... Tough my favourite part was, without a doubt, the Farm, Which is not Hyperbolic!!

Also the oracle is a bit to cryptic in my opinon

39 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
What a delightful game! If you don't mind a game that's a little light on gameplay it's a pretty fun experience, being in the weird hyperbolic space in 3D. It's short but I wasn't expecting it to be very long. My favorite section is the art museum because of it's flooring, it reminds you how strange hyperbolic space is. All the tiles are squares but 6 of them meet up in a corner. I wasn't expecting to find an entire world and lore either. My main gripe is the video controls are a bit confusing; it mentions Hz in the resolution setting but it doesn't seem to mean anything in there since it just uses what your monitor's already set at. It's a shame Oculus controls seem to be missing, I was excited about playing in VR.

This guy has a sweet Youtube channel too where he shows off weird things you can do with math concepts. He made that "Marble Marcher" game that lets you roll around as a ball on 3D fractals. He's also posted a few vids on the development of this if you want to learn about what's going on under the hood.
 
SteelDrake
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
The maximum and bigger implementation of non-euclidiean gameplay design I could have ever imagined. Moreover the main dynamic the game is based on gets integrated with the rest of it's elements perfectly and in a very very original way.

The few problems I've seen/felt while playing the game are that some people would struggle at first when trying to understand the world design (but it's sensation quite normal if you haven't played any non-euclidean games before), and that the final "level" (without getting into spoiler territory) gets quite confusing since you are a little bit likely to find the way to face it by error while trying to understand what's happening around you.

Appart from those two things the game is overall quite solid and enjoyable, with a lot of interesting dialogues and side quest to do and explore.

Here you have a playthrough in case you need to find any solution ^^:
Vidéo YouTube™: Hyperbolica FULL GAME WALKTHROUGH Gameplay HD (PC) | NO COMMENTARY 
Vues : 10,145

Ragnarock30
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
I'm obviously biased as I've been excited for Hyperbolica since it was announced, but I'm having an absolute blast. CodeParade has helped give me a new appreciation for math, specifically geometry, topology, and projection. I've probably watched the devlogs for this game a dozen times because they're just so darn interesting. Finally getting to walk, and look around in this wonderful piece of software is incredible. I was most excited for spherical geometry, I just entered the farm area and got goosebumps. Seeing the space warp around me, challenging, and embracing various expectations I'd had for spherical geometry was indescribably mind-blowing. I'm only an hour in, but I couldn't help myself from coming to write this review. I've been struggling to enjoy playing video games the past while, however Hyperbolica just clicked immediately. I haven't felt this immersed in a game in years. I'm so glad this project has finally come to fruition. Thank you, CodeParade and João Kalva, this is a literal dream come true.

EDIT: Those saying that the price is steep for "a two hour adventure" obviously haven't experienced all of the content in this game yet. I'm now a few hours in and still only have 3 of the platonic shapes. There are so many minigames and ways to interact with the NPCs, taking your time to experience it all is very much worth it in my opinion. No many hidden little jokes and interesting conversations. I especially like the little 'storylines' you can follow with various NPCs (ie. the ViewTube guy).

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
Hyperbolica is a charming little game with quite an open development log. CodeParade has in the past posted logs of their work to their YouTube channel. What started as a simple wonder of what it was like to live on a hyperbolic plane turned into a fun 3D romp through a strange and trippy space with plenty of fun puzzles and so far an interesting narrative.

If you are a math geek or find hyperbolics fascinating, I can't recommend this and HyperRogue enough.

116 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
Keeping things as simple as I can here 'Hyperbolica' is a low poly adventure game with a fairly large world to explore and possible hundreds of charters to interact with. But that is not a normal VR world like we are all used to it is a hyperbolic space adventure where everything looks far away but is in fact closer than you think. While this is a VERY cool effect (and kudos to the developer for making this game, it must have been a nightmare to code), it is also nauseating as hell and back. I consider myself to have my VR legs and can endure a lot of motion sickness, but this game made me feel a little queasy and I had to stop.

While low poly and all the chat is in text blocks there is still enough content here to keep you going way past the point of value and would probably take you even longer to find all the hidden trinkets. I really am impressed with the game and for me it gets an easy recommendation. But I have to say I couldn't make it work with the Oculus Quest and no matter what headset I used (sticking with the Rift C in the end) I couldn't get it to work with my motion controllers and I had to use a Gamepad (which I didn't mind at all). While I might have to play it in short doses I think I will enjoy exploring this game and it gets an easy thumbs up from me.

Do check out my gameplay video -
Vidéo YouTube™: Hyperbolica (Steam VR) - Valve Index & HTC Vive - Gameplay no Commentary 
Vues : 610
For a review of Hyperbolica and download links please do visit the website in the link below. →→→ https://www.virtual-reality-shop.co.uk/hyperbolica-steam-vr ←←← Buy the Latest VR Headsets Now on...
 
Just_G
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
[Story] : 5/10
[Gameplay] : 6/10
[Soundtrack/Music] : 8/10
[Audio Design] : 8/10
[Visuals/Graphics] : 8/10
[Difficulty] : 3/10
[Overall] : 7/10

When I got the notification that the game dropped, I had to instantly buy it. I've been following this game ever since the first devlogs came out and was so excited to see that it's finally here. I got around to playing it and really enjoyed the whole nature of this game. It's short, sweet, and and an incredible non-euclidean experience. I'd be lying if I said I didn't get a little nauseous throughout this game, but it wasn't the end of the world. It's definitely with the way our eyes are naturally trained that games like this "make brain hurt."

The game itself isn't anything too particularly spectacular but it complements the essence of the game perfectly. In fact, the simple nature of this game made it a whole lot better than if it were any more complex. I love illusions and especially non-euclidean things so this game was long-awaited. The story, music, and visuals are all simple but it's the perfect balance which makes it so well done. I really enjoyed the little bits of gameplay spread throughout the game to showoff the nature of hyperbolic non-euclidean space. I'm a sucker for these. I've finished the game, a little quick quite frankly, but am definitely planning to go back to explore the rest of the game more since there's a lot of things I definitely missed out on.

It has been incredible to see where this game has gone and to see what's next for it. I haven't gotten around to trying it in VR yet but I'll definitely hit that up soon. Huge props to the dev for making this incredible and unique game and experience.
 
Don Hut

5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
Man, I just keep wanting to give Cornelius a big hug!

Yeah, this is a good 'un. I've been watching this for a while. It's exactly what you expect from an indie game at this price point (in a good way) - creative visuals, good writing, a cool and fairly unique core concept explored in a few ways, and a few hours to get through the whole thing blind. Really glad I picked this up - I can see myself going back soon to try it out in VR, I can imagine it's quite trippy that way!

I've been following the development of this for years, and I think the work has paid off. Good job, devs.

kakben
207 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2022
This is a very fun game. It's simple, it's interesting, and it's obviously unique.

I will say, however, if you're someone who gets headaches easily, I'd be VERY careful while playing this game. I was playing for a bit, and my head was absolutely killing me, and I was pretty disoriented. I never felt like I was going to be sick necessarily, but I certainly wasn't feeling well. I recommend taking frequent breaks, including walking around a bit. Get your land-legs back, get your head and vision straightened back out, and then continue. If you're willing to do that now and again, I highly recommend this game!
 
Don Provolone
